Definitions.Definition_Content: A splitting field $L$ of a polynomial $f \\(in K[X]\\) with coefficients in a field $K$ is a field extension $L / K$ where the polynomial $f$ splits into linear factors.
An extension $L / K$ is called separable if it does not contain any inseparable algebraic elements over $K$.
An extension $K_{r} / K$ is Galois if it is both normal and separable.

Definitions.Concept_Name: Galois group of a Field Extension
Definitions.Definition_Content: The Galois group $\\operatorname{Gal}(L / K)$ of an extension $L / K$ is the group of all field automorphisms of $L$ that fix every element of $K$.

A group $G$ is called solvable if there exists a chain of subgroups $G_{0} \\supsetneq G_{1} \\supsetneq \\ldots \\supsetneq G_{r}=\\{1\\}$ such that each $G_{i+1}$ is a normal subgroup of $G_{i}$ and the residue class group $G_{i} / G_{i+1}$ is abelian.

Theorems.Theorem_Content: Every chain of fields of type $K=K_{0} \\subsetneq K_{1} \\subsetneq \\ldots \\subsetneq K_{r}$, where $L \\subset K_{r}$ and each $K_{i+1}$ is obtained by adjoining a root of some element in $K_{i}$, is equivalent to a chain of subgroups of the Galois group $\\operatorname{Gal}(K_{r} / K)$.

An equation $f(x)=0$ is solvable by radicals if and only if there exists a chain of subgroups of the Galois group $\\operatorname{Gal}(L / K)$ such that each $G_{i+1}$ is a normal subgroup of $G_{i}$ and the residue class group $G_{i} / G_{i+1}$ is cyclic.
In any finite group, there exist subgroups whose order is a power of a prime, and these subgroups have specific properties related to the structure of the group.
